Posts.Title: Nipple itch

Posts.Content: On Sep 23, 2016 10:02 pm niallsmum wrote: Just one Linda. I don't understand it all either????Hi Linda, it’s been two years but my left nipple is inflamed and scaly again. When I last spoke with the breast consultant, she suggested that I might just have eczema on my nipple and to use cream on it. But it’s still there after two years. And only on one nipple. Should I go back to see the consultant? I feel a bit silly if it’s still only eczema.
Posts.Title: Nipple itch

Posts.Content: Hello everyone, I've had a really bad itch in my left nipple for about two months. I'm also extremely tired all of the time. My doctor sent me for a mammogram, which was clear. I then had an ultrasound and the doctor said that my lymph glands in my underarm were swollen, so she did a needle biopsy. I then spoke with the surgeon/consultant. She said that there is definitely 'something there' even though there is no lump. I asked if that ruled out cancer and she said not necessarily and to wait for the biopsy results next week. However, I have a gut feeling that there is something wrong. Does anyone know what it might be?
Posts.Title: Nipple itch

Posts.Content: I forgot to say, I get my results on Friday...

Posts.Content: DogmaW1, Thank you so much for your reply. So far, I've had no symptoms other than the itch and extreme fatigue. Waiting to get the results of my biopsy is unbearable. I feel really healthy otherwise, so maybe I'm worrying about nothing....... Thanks again. Stay well.

Posts.Content: I got my results today. Negative for cancer. They said that I have a low grade infection in my lungs. Had chest X-ray and more blood tests. Results in two weeks. More waiting!!!!' Thank you so much for advice and support. Marian.
